description.article_summary: Defines key VAT terms such as taxable person, input tax, exempt supply, place of supply, designated zones, and tax invoices.
VAT applies to taxable and deemed supplies, as well as imports unless exempted.
A standard VAT rate of 5% applies unless specified otherwise.
VAT must be paid by suppliers, importers, and recipients of services under the reverse charge mechanism.
A supply occurs when goods are sold, transferred, or contracted for future transfer.
A supply of services is any transaction that is not a supply of goods.
Some transactions, such as vouchers and business transfers, are not VAT|applicable supplies.

description.article_name: Article 8 | Supply Consisting of More Than One Component
description.article_summary: VAT treatment for bundled goods and services depends on the main supply.
Defines VAT obligations when selling through an agent in their own name or on behalf of a principal.
Government entities must charge VAT unless acting in a sovereign capacity.
Certain transactions are treated as supplies for VAT, such as assets no longer used for business, internal transfers, or goods/services used for non|business purposes.
A supply is not deemed taxable if no input tax was claimed, it is an exempt supply, or falls below the Executive Regulation limit.
A person must register for VAT if taxable supplies exceed the mandatory threshold, or if they are a non|resident making taxable supplies.
Two or more businesses can register as a single VAT entity if they meet the conditions.
Businesses making only zero|rated supplies can apply for VAT registration exemption.

description.article_name: Article 16 | Tax Registration of Government Entities
description.article_summary: Government entities must register and deregister based on Cabinet decisions.
Businesses can voluntarily register if they exceed the voluntary registration threshold.

description.article_name: Article 18 | Tax Registration for a Non|Resident
description.article_summary: A non|resident supplying goods/services in the UAE must register for VAT.

description.article_name: Article 19 | Calculating the Tax Registration Threshold
description.article_summary: Total taxable supplies determine VAT registration eligibility.
Capital asset sales do not count towards VAT registration thresholds.
A business must deregister if it stops making taxable supplies or falls below the voluntary threshold.
A VAT|registered entity can apply for deregistration if no longer meeting VAT requirements.
A voluntarily registered business must wait 12 months before applying for deregistration.

description.article_name: Article 24 | Procedures, Controls, and Conditions of Tax Registration and Deregistration
description.article_summary: The Executive Regulation specifies registration and deregistration rules.

description.article_name: Article 26 | Date of Supply in Special Cases
description.article_summary: Contracts with periodic payments follow specific VAT timing rules.

description.article_name: Article 27 | Place of Supply of Goods
description.article_summary: VAT applies where the supply physically takes place.

description.article_name: Article 28 | Place of Supply of Water and Energy
description.article_summary: VAT treatment depends on the customer’s place of residence.

description.article_name: Article 29 | Place of Supply of Services
description.article_summary: Services are taxable based on the supplier’s place of business.

description.article_name: Article 30 | Place of Supply in Special Cases
description.article_summary: Special rules apply for imports, telecommunications, and electronic services.

description.article_name: Article 30 | Place of Supply in Special Cases
description.article_summary: Special rules apply for determining the place of supply for certain services and goods.

description.article_name: Article 31 | Place of Supply of Telecommunication and Electronic Services
description.article_summary: VAT is applied based on where telecom and electronic services are used or enjoyed.
Defines how the place of establishment for a business is determined for VAT purposes.
Outlines the VAT obligations when an agent acts on behalf of another party.
Specifies how the taxable value of a supply is calculated for VAT purposes.
VAT on imports is calculated based on the customs value of the goods.

description.article_name: Article 36 | Value of Supply and Deemed Supply for Related Parties
description.article_summary: Defines the valuation rules for supplies between related parties.
Specifies how the value is determined for deemed supplies.
Prices must include VAT unless explicitly stated otherwise.

description.article_name: Article 39 | Value of Supply in Case of Discounts or Subsidies
description.article_summary: VAT is adjusted when discounts or subsidies apply to a supply.

description.article_name: Article 40 | Value of Supply of Vouchers
description.article_summary: The taxable amount for vouchers is the difference between the sale price and the face value.

description.article_name: Article 41 | Value of Supply of Postage Stamps
description.article_summary: VAT applies to the value of postage stamps based on their face value.
Outlines VAT rules for goods temporarily transferred outside the UAE.

description.article_name: Article 43 | Charging Tax Based on Profit Margin
description.article_summary: In certain cases, VAT can be charged only on the profit margin instead of the total value.

description.article_name: Article 44 | Supply and Import Taxable at Zero Rate
description.article_summary: Lists transactions that are taxable at a 0% VAT rate.

description.article_name: Article 45 | Goods and Services Subject to Zero Rate
description.article_summary: Specifies goods and services like healthcare, education, and exports that qualify for a 0% VAT rate.
Defines exempt supplies such as financial services and residential leases.

description.article_name: Article 47 | Supply Consisting of More Than One Component
description.article_summary: Explains how VAT applies to mixed supplies involving multiple components.
Outlines when the recipient must account for VAT instead of the supplier.
Details VAT rules for specific goods imported into the UAE.
Defines VAT|free designated zones and conditions for exemption.

description.article_name: Article 51 | Transfer of Goods in Designated Zones
description.article_summary: Specifies conditions under which VAT is not applied to goods transferred in designated zones.
Lists cases where VAT applies even in designated zones.
Explains how to calculate the VAT payable or refundable.
Identifies input tax that can be reclaimed by businesses.

description.article_summary: Defines the process for recovering input tax within a specific tax period.

description.article_name: Article 56 | Input Tax before Tax Registration
description.article_summary: Allows businesses to reclaim VAT paid before registration.

description.article_name: Article 57 | Recovery of Tax by Government Entities and Charities
description.article_summary: Covers VAT refunds for eligible government entities and charities.

description.article_name: Article 58 | Calculating the Input Tax that may be Recovered

description.article_name: Article 59 | Conditions and Mechanism of Input Tax Adjustment
description.article_summary: Specifies when and how businesses can adjust their input tax claims.

description.article_name: Article 61 | Instances and Conditions for Output Tax Adjustments
description.article_summary: Lists situations where businesses can adjust their output tax.

description.article_name: Article 62 | Mechanism for Output Tax Adjustment
description.article_summary: Explains the process for making output tax adjustments on returns.

description.article_summary: Details how VAT is adjusted when a tax credit note is issued.

description.article_summary: Specifies mandatory information and timing for issuing tax invoices.

description.article_name: Article 66 | Document of Supplies to Implementing States
description.article_summary: Defines documentation requirements for supplies to implementing states.
